Kapolri Idham Azis Dapat Tiga Pesan dari Jokowi
01 Nov 2019, 05:59 by Friski Riana, Amirullah
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Kepala Kepolisian RI Jenderal Idham Azis mengaku mendapatkan pesan dari Presiden Joko Widodo atau Jokowi usai dilantik. "Bapak Presiden memberikan, menyampaikan kepada saya kerja, kerja, dan kerja," kata Idham di Istana Negara, Jakarta, Jumat, 1 November 2019.
Idham mengaku bersyukur karena telah diberikan kepercayaan untuk mengemban amanah sebagai Kapolri. "Saya juga ucapkan terima kasih kepada Bapak Presiden Jokowi yang telah mempercayakan kepada saya untuk menjalankan tugas ini selaku Kapolri," kata Idham.
Dia pun memohon doa dari masyarakat supaya bisa meningkatkan dan melanjutkan pemantapan kerja sama dengan TNI untuk menjaga keamanan dan ketertiban masyarakat Indonesia.
Idham telah resmi dilantik sebagai Kapolri oleh Presiden Jokowi hari ini di Istana Negara, Jakarta. Ia menggantikan Tito Karnavian yang diangkat sebagai Menteri Dalam Negeri.
Dalam pelantikan, Idham mengambil sumpah jabatan untuk setia kepada negara dan UUD 1945. "Bahwa saya dalam menjalankan tugas jabatan akan menjunjung tinggi etika jabatan bekerja dengan sebaik-baiknya dan dengan penuh rada tanggung jawab. Bahwa saya akan menjunjung tinggi tribrata," kata Idham mengulang sumpah yang dibacakan Jokowi.
Idham merupakan lulusan Akademi Kepolisian 1988. Lelaki kelahiran Kendari, Sulawesi Tenggara, 30 Januari 1963 ini dikenal berwawasan di bidang reserse dan antiteror. Jabatan terakhir Idham Azis adalah sebagai Kepala Badan Reserse Kriminal Mabes Polri.

National Police Chief Idham Azis Got Three Messages from Jokowi
01 Nov 2019, 05:59 by Friski Riana, Amirullah
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Indonesian Police Chief General Idham Azis claimed to have received a message from President Joko Widodo or Jokowi after being installed. "Mr. President gave, conveyed to me work, work and work," said Idham at the State Palace, Jakarta, Friday, November 1, 2019.
Idham said he was grateful because he had been given the trust to carry out the mandate as the National Police Chief. "I also thank Mr. President Jokowi for entrusting me to carry out this task as the National Police Chief," Idham said.
He also asked for prayers from the community so that they could improve and continue to strengthen cooperation with the TNI to maintain the security and order of the Indonesian people.
Idham was officially appointed as National Police Chief by President Jokowi today at the State Palace, Jakarta. He replaces Tito Karnavian who was appointed as Minister of the Interior.
In his inauguration, Idham took the oath of office to be loyal to the state and the 1945 Constitution. "That in carrying out my duties will uphold the ethics of the office to work as well as possible and with full responsibility. That I will uphold the tribrata," Idham repeated the oath read by Jokowi.
Idham is a graduate of the Police Academy in 1988. This man, born in Kendari, Southeast Sulawesi, January 30, 1963, is known to be knowledgeable in the field of investigation and anti-terror. Idham Azis' last position was as Head of the Indonesian Police Headquarters Criminal Investigation Agency.
